fr.sii.ogham.core.retry

Class FixedIntervalRetry

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.retry.FixedIntervalRetry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RetryStrategy

    public class FixedIntervalRetry
extends Object
implements RetryStrategy
    Retry several times with a fixed delay between each try until the maximum attempts is reached. The next execution is based on the execution start date. If delay is 500ms and max retries is 5, it means that a retry will be attempted every 500ms until 5 attempts are reached (inclusive). For example, you want to connect to an external system at t1=0 and the connection timeout (100ms) is triggered at t2=100ms. Using this retry will provide the following behavior:
    • 0: connect
    • 100: timeout
    • 500: connect
    • 600: timeout
    • 1000: connect
    • 1100: timeout
    • 1500: connect
    • 1600: timeout
    • 2000: connect
    • 2100: timeout
    • 2500: connect
    • 2600: timeout
    • fail
    NOTE: The provided date doesn't take the duration of the execution in account. If an execution takes 1s to execute while retry delay is set to 500ms, there may have several executions in parallel. However, this totally depends on the RetryExecutor implementation. For example SimpleRetryExecutor won't run several executions in parallel. In this case, it will execute the action as soon as the previous one has failed therefore the delay may not be complied.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet
